page.title: 12HOUSING NORTH HUISH CONT'D.
page.content: One erstwhile owner of Fowelscombe also once lived at {BLACK HALL,}which still exists. Whetcombe is a { GEORGIAN HOUSE but the lodge is derelict. Coombe House is possibly Georgian also but may be only Georgian fronted. In the grounds there are a pool and a stream. Stone built barns are being converted into modern accommodation. Higher Ford Cottage is residential with horsebox, so possibly used for riding. Lower Ford Cottage purely residential, now two cottages which were once a 19th century Chapel. Lower Norris, now called Coombe Norris Farm with 206 acres. Southern House is mixed farming.Higher Spriddlescombe is also Georgian. Ley Georgian with Dutch barn, machinery sheds and an {ANCIENT {BUTTER WELL} in the garden. Burnt Pine was originally {VILLAGE ALMSHOUSES}of the 16th Century..
